questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about SIP, per RFC 326? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Correct answers: A (for reservation RSVP is required), C, D.
E is wrong since SIP can be used also for presence, IM, etc

choices.A: SIP does not provide for resource reservation.
choices.C: A SIP transaction occurs between a client and a server.
choices.E: SIP signaling can only be used for voice over IP thereby limiting its use as a general signaling protocol.
choices.B: SIP defines native methods for negotiating media streams.
choices.D: To set up a voice session, SIP relies on protocols such as SDP and RTP.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about a realm on the Session Border Controller?

choices.C: It is a logical definition of a network or group of networks comprising devices that provide real-time communication.
choices.B: It is a layer 3 abstraction of a VoIP network.
choices.A: It can only have one steering pool port per realm.
choices.E: It is a collection of IP devices that perform IP routing functions.
choices.D: It is a layer 5 abstraction of a VoIP network.

questions.question_text: Which two states are needed by the active node while transitioning to standby? (Choose two.)

comments.content: Nope, it’s D (relinquish active= I’m passing my sessions to other device) and E (becoming standby = I’m ready to receive information about sessions from other device)

questions.question_text: What is the first thing you should do when you want the Session Border Controller to detect that an endpoint is behind a NAT/firewall device?

choices.D: Navigate to the sip-port configuration element and set the nat-traversal parameter to enabled.
choices.E: Navigate to the sip-interface configuration element and set the nat-traversal parameter to detect.
choices.C: Navigate to the sip-interface configuration element and set the nat-traversal parameter to always.
choices.A: Navigate to the sip-port configuration element and set the nat-traversal parameter to disabled.
choices.B: Navigate to the sip-interface configuration element and set the nat-traversal parameter to never.

questions.question_text:
To ensure proper operation of a Session Border Controller High Availability (HA) pair, it is critical that both of the devices can originate legitimate traffic on media interfaces independent of the network interface IP address.
How is this type of traffic accommodated?

discussion.content: IMO correct answer is B (it’s about HA for media interfaces, not management interfaces)

choices.C: by setting the utility address and sec-gateway values to addresses in different subnets as the IP address configured on the wancom interfaces
choices.A: by setting the pri-utility-addr, sec-utility-addr, and sec-gateway values to addresses in the same subnet as the IP address configured on the management interfaces
choices.E: via the utility address parameters on the wancoml and wancom2 interfaces
choices.D: by setting a unique address on the wancoml and wancom2 interfaces via the utility address command
choices.B: by setting the pri-utility-addr, sec-utility-addr, and sec-gateway values to addresses in the same subnet as the IP address configured on the media interfaces
